Name: Bakery Style Chocolate Chip Muffins
Ingredients: 1C. Milk, 1/4C. Vinegar, 2 1/2C. All-Purpose Flour, 1T. Baking Powder, 1t. Baking Soda, 1/2t. Salt, 1C. Granulated Sugar, 1/2C. Butter (melted), 2 Large Eggs, 1T. Vanilla, 1 1/2 C. Miniature Chocolate Chips, Optional - Sanding Sugar for sprinkling
Step 1: Step 1: Preheat oven to 425F. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray.
Step 2: In a small bowl, pour the milk and vinegar. Let sit while preparing the remaining ingredients.
Step 3: In a larger bowl, mix together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and sugar. Add the butter, eggs, vanilla, and the  milk + vinegar mixture. Stir JUST until a batter with lumps forms.
Step 5: Fill each cup in the muffin tin to be completely full (about a heaping 1/4 cup).
Step 6: Bake at 425F for 5 minutes. Then decrease the heat to 375F and bake for another 13 minutes.
Step 7: Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before removing from the tin and serving.

Name: Easy Lemon Bread
Ingredients: 1 Pkg. (16.5 oz) Lemon Cake Mix, 1 Pkg. (3.4 oz) Instant Lemon Pudding Mix, 1/2C. Vegetable Oil (or melted coconut oil), 1C. Cold Water, 4 Eggs
Step 1: Combine all ingredents in a large bowl and beat with a hand mixer for about 3-4 minutes.
Step 2: Pour into 2 loaf pans that have been greased and floured or baking sprayed.
Step 3: Bake at 350F for about 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
Step 4: Leave in pans for a few minutes before removing the loaves and placing on a wire rack to cool.
Original Creator: Butter with a Side of Bread

Name: Blueberry Lemon Muffin Mix Cookies
Ingredients: 2 Pkg. (7 oz) Blueberry Muffin Mix, 1/4C. Butter (softened), 1/4C. Vegetable Shorting, 1t. Lemon Extract, 1 Pkg. Instant Lemon Pudding Mix, 2 Eggs, 4oz. White Candy Melts
Step 2: Mix all ingredients in medium bowl until blending.
Step 3: Drop by tablespoon onto parchment covered baking sheet or greased cookie sheet.
Step 4: Bake in preheated oven for 12-14 minutes.
Step 5: Allow to cool for about 3 minutes on cookie sheet then remove cookies and allow to cool completely.
Step 6: While cookies are cooling make Icing Drizzle.
Step 7: Mix powdered sugar and lemon juice; gradually add 1t. of water at a time to mixture until desired consistency is acheived.
Step 8: When cookies are cool drizzle with Icing Drizzle

Name: Sausage Cheese Balls
Ingredients: 3C. Bisquick Mix, 1Lb. Unooked Bulk Pork Sausage, 4C. Shredded Cheddar Cheese, 1/2C. Grated Parmesean Cheese, 1/2C. Milk, 1/2t. Dried Rosemary Leaves (crushed), 1 1/2 t. Chopped Fresh Parsley or 1/2t. Parsley Flakes, Optional - Barbecue Sauce or Chili Sauce for dipping
Step 2: Lightly grease bottom and sides of jelly roll pan or shallow casserole dish.
Step 3: In large bowl, stir together all ingredients except barbecue sauce, using hands or spoon. Shape mixture into 1-inch balls. Place in pan.
Step 4: Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until brown. Immediately remove from pan.
Step 5: Serve warm with sauce for dipping.

Name: Crockpot Blackberry Cobbler
Ingredients: 2C. Blackberries (washed), 1C. Flour, 1C. Milk, 1 1/4C. Sugar (divided), 1/4C. Melted Butter
Step 1: In a bowl mix together flour, milk, 1C. sugar & butter until batter forms. Pour into a greased 4qt. crockpot.
Step 2: Sprinkle in the washed blackberries and top witht he final 1/4C. of sugar.
Step 3: Cover and cook on high 2 - 2 1/2 hours.
Step 4: Serve with ice cream or whipped cream.
